author: Staff Reporter
text:
The 10-day Panguni Uthiram festival will startwith flag hoisting at Sri Thiru Avinankudi Temple in Palani near here on March 17.

Flag hoisting will take place between 10 a.m. and 11.30 a.m. on that date. The celestial wedding of Lord Murugan with Goddesses Deivanai and Valli will be performed between 7.30 p.m. and 9 p.m. on March 22, and the holy car procession along the Giri veedhis will be conducted at 4.30 p.m. the next day. Temple officials said that cultural programmes had been arranged at Kudamuzhukku Mandapam near Malai Adivaram between 4 p.m. and 9 p.m. during the festival days. The idols of Lord Murugan and Goddesses Deivanai and Valli would be taken in a procession on various mounts along the Giri veedhis in the evenings on all the days.

Temporary shelters had been erected at 42 places on prime roads, especially Palani-Dindigul Main Road, Madurai-Palani Road, Vadamadurai-Oddanchatram Road, Dharapuram-Palani Road and Udumalai-Palani Road.
title: Panguni Uthiram festival in Palani from March 17
